Class Service

java.lang.Object
Service
public class Service extends Object
The Service class loads words from Trimmed.csv and stores indexes of those words, providing all the functionalities related to word sources.

      public Service()

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Service getInstance()
      Returns an instance of current class, where only one copy of instance will exist.

      If no instance found, a new one will be generated and stored. Otherwise, the stored one will be return.

      Returns:
      an instance of current class.

    • initService

      public String initService(String[] wordSources, String[] wordLengths)
      Returns a string representation of initialization results.

      If the returning String is empty, the initialization process is successfully completed. Otherwise, the returning String will contain error details.

      Parameters:
      wordSources - a String array containing word sources ordered by difficulty increasingly.
      wordLengths - a String array containing word lengths ordered increasingly.
      Returns:
      a string representation of initialization results.

    • checkExistence

      public String checkExistence(String word, String wordSource)
      Returns a string representation of checking results.

      If the returning String is empty, the word given is valid. Otherwise, the returning String will contain error details.

      If the word entered is empty, the return will also be empty as it's a representation of a random word from the word source.

      Parameters:
      word - an uppercase String to be checked in the difficulty level of wordSource.
      wordSource - a String representing the difficulty level of current setting.
      Returns:
      a string representation of checking results.

    • generateRandomWord

      public String generateRandomWord(int wordLength, String wordSource)
      Returns a random word with O(1) time complexity under given restrictions.

      If the returning String is not "Not Found", the word returns is valid.

      Parameters:
      wordLength - an int describing the length restriction.
      wordSource - a String representing the difficulty level of current setting.
      Returns:
      a random word or "Not Found" under given conditions.

    • validateHelperInput

      public String validateHelperInput(String helperInput)
      This method returns the result of helper input checking and matched results. Word length and word source configuration is attained directly from Settings.
      Parameters:
      helperInput - a String describing the input from the helper input text field.
      Returns:
      a String containing error reason, which will be empty if no error found, and matched results. The error reason and matched results are separated by "$".
